alert.note: Alert for Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 3:23AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Vanderburgh and Warrick. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 AM CDT, Spotter and radar estimates indicate 2 to 3 inches of rain has fallen in parts of Warrick county, particularly near Boonville and Newburgh since 130 am. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evansville, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Melody Hill, Folsomville and Tennyson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
